author: callyfromauron
title: Penny Lane Liverpool Philosophy Hub
description: There is a lack of philosophical discussion at community level about Cardano, so an opportunity to engage people is being missed.

f6_assessments.q0: There is an interesting problem raised by this proposal. According to the team, there is a lack of philosophical discussion about Cardano, so there is an entire segment of the population we are not reaching. In order to address this problem, they propose that people build and promote discussion about blockchain and Cardano in communities such as "Philosophy in Pubs (PIPs)". I find this extremely interesting, since in this case the community has been established with a robust organization and the purpose of this proposal is to introduce the entire blockchain universe from a philosophical standpoint. The objective and metrics of this proposal are aligned with those required by the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: In terms of feasibility, I have nothing but praise for the team. Each point is addressed in detail. The project is led by two very well known and committed community members. Despite this, there is an excellent description of skills and experience as well as links for verifying them. The level of detail provided in the "project detail" section provides the community with an understanding of the implementation steps involved. There is also a high level of detail in the descriptions of the budget items, addressing all aspects of the budget. Finally, the team describes an entire section that indicates what risks are identified at the time, as well as the countermeasures to reduce or eliminate them.
f6_assessments.q2: There are five phases identified in the proposal, with an estimated close in December of 2022. From the description provided, we are able to understand what will be taking place during the project implementation. The success metrics were also described, which were accompanied not only with a description of the metric but also with a prediction of the timeframe for achievement. As an aspect of improvement, I would like to draw your attention to the fact that there are some metrics that could be improved as they are very general, which makes it difficult to measure, for example, "Building sustainable and lasting connections between catalyst and PIPs" What does this mean?, and how can the community audit this metric?, another example would be "Increased awareness of Cardano in as many as 30 other communities" What does the team understand by "increase awareness"?Lastly, another element that confuses me is that both of these metrics mentioned have an assigned time frame of "after 12 months". It is difficult to know when the team expects to achieve these success metrics.

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea is good (outside the box, I would say) and the proposal is very well strcutured.
Developing the tools and "evangelizing" are usually the main drivers in the proposals but discuss social and philosophical implicantions of new technology should be as important as. It allow us to see it in a more critical points of view and grasp both the positive sides and its drawbacks (as every technology has), bringing even better proposals in the future, that could potentially address bad implications.

I liked it will be translated in other language, a whole set of content (toolkit) will be available for those who also want to learn in its own country/city andthar  the idea is to expand it to other cities in the UK, which combined amplifies proposal impact.

As minor suggestion, I'd have included the number of people they intend to engage, at least in the face to face meetings or the number of people that usually attend the regular PIPs sessions

All in all, the proposal does address the challenge, engaging and scaling up local commmunities, possibly bringing new members, and has a potential to raise different and fruitful discussions.
f6_assessments.q1:
Theres an already committed team with experience in such acitivities proposed. Its also possible to verify the information by the links provided. The team has 2 people and it seems enough to run this project, specially with alrerady existing connections with the PIPs.

There's a solid and sensible time-framed plan/timeline and budget breakdown is clear and well strucutured. My only point is that it seems quite an expesive project.

In a summary, projects does seem feasible with a sensible plan, clear budget allocation and a team with required capabilitiesand experience to make the bridge between phisophy and Cardano. Its imporant to mention though that the engagement of the PIPs are essential for this project - but that is clearly a challenge mentioned and mitigated in the risk management
f6_assessments.q2:
The project has really good time-framed KPIs with target which helps to evualuate the progress as it evolves and have a reference wheter success was achieved or not. Some milestones can also be extracted from the timeline proposed.

The risk management part is really well done with the main risks mapped and a mitigation strategy in place. 
I confess when I started to read the proposal my main concern was that the PIPs may not engage with this project and that would ruin everything here. However,  the proposers had already identified it and it was the first iten mentioned in the risk part and they already started working to minimize the likelihood of this happen

f6_assessments.q0: Build a Philosophy Hub is a creative way to scale-up Cardano's Community since currently there is nothing similar. First, stick to PIP and then the community contribution of this project can be broaden with other philosophy community out there. The project is potential to be a first attract point to Cardano ecosystem to philosophy specifically and to academic community in general. Plus, the contribute of these new commers will be great since everything need to have philosophy base to develop sustainablely.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal presents well the team has skill in peer facilitator and community engagement. They also a member of both community: philosophy and Cardano Catalyst so they might know what is the "selling point" to attract people like them. The project is planed well with detail steps and outputs and KPIs. Especially they have Risk assessment, which demonstrates that they aware of the risk and have plan to deal with it.
f6_assessments.q2: The expected output and KPIs are on point. However I think the KPI "Onboard 10 participants into Catalyst via attending Swarm sessions / AfterTownHall" is quite low-set. They can target more: at least bring 50 new members to Cardano Catalyst.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal clearly defines as problem "the lack of philosophical  discussion" about Cardano in the community level.
As for, the proposers suggest to build a philosophy-based hub through building relationship with established philosophers' networks.
The proposal addresses the challenge by planning to meet a group of people, engaging and onboarding them to Cardano.
In my point of view, the Catalyst community has a lot to gain with this proposal by having a philosophers group participating in the discussions, networking, producing learning content as well as translating in other languages to outreach even more people.
This open-source project could be replicate to achieve similar goals in any other cardano community hub.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal is very likely to be successful implemented, considering the skills provided show relevant experience required to its implementation.

The budget outline is reasonable , but – in my point of view – the item "Publicity/marketing the project's sessions, in Liverpool and within Catalyst" could be more detailed.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided presents a step-by-step planning, with a reasonable timeline, roadmap and milestones. The project is open source and the KPIs are in place, which will make this project totally auditable.

solution: Work with established community philosophy networks, to build a philosophy-based Hub and lead philosophy discussion within Catalyst.
experience: Vanessa Cardui and Stephen Whitenstall are skilled community facilitators; ex-members of Liverpool PIPs; and active within Catalyst.
